Articles.Content: I can't wait to try and visit those planets. I'm pretty sure I'll loose some Kerbonauts in the depths of space. But hey, sacrifices have to be made for science.

Those orbit and SOI pics are very interesting.

Moho -- 0.4 KU (5.4e9 m), 2.5e22 kg (0.46 Kerbins)

Eve -- 0.8 KU (1.1e10 m), 9.47e22 kg (1.8 Kerbins)

Duna -- 1.4 KU (1.9e10 m), 5.56e21 kg (0.1 Kerbins)

Jool -- 5 KU (6.8e10 m), 4.34e24 kg (80 Kerbins)

Better figures will wait for someone with a ruler. Or 0.17, when they'll get much easier to work out.

Moho -- 0.4 KU (5.4e9 m), 2.5e22 kg (0.46 Kerbins)

Eve -- 0.8 KU (1.1e10 m), 9.47e22 kg (1.8 Kerbins)

Duna -- 1.4 KU (1.9e10 m), 5.56e21 kg (0.1 Kerbins)

Jool -- 5 KU (6.8e10 m), 4.34e24 kg (80 Kerbins)

Is there a relationship between SOI size and body mass? Or are those just rough guesses?

hey im a "whiny twelve year old" and i understand about it being an alpha,dont stereo type

say sorry

I am sorry Nutt, was been stereotypical in his comment.

Sadly however it was the vocal minority (with pitch forks an torch's) that went for Developer blood, when they released a poor quality buggy experimental to the whole community.

This is what lead to the Experimental Test Team been created 4-5 months ago.

Ohh, it has it perks, an I am honoured too be part of the Team, working (often very fun/rewarding) to find these bugs, so you's can play much more stable builds.

As I understand it the Test Team is 50+ Members (Not including Dev's + Moderators)

More positions may become open in time.

This looks interesting. That's one heck of a transfer burn you're going to need...

Or lots and lots of time, books and oxygen .

I like all the additions in the dev post, except the 'clicking the middle mouse button' part. I assume it's configurable, but I know that most 'middle buttons' are in fact the mousewheel, and are pretty hard to click, or double-click, without moving them.

So after reading that I did a little bit of research on NERVA rockets and Nuclear Thermal Engines. First I thought these things worked by making nuclear explosions

There was such a project, Project Orion, which basically dumped small nukes out the back and blew them up behind a heavy shield with lots of shock absorbers. It never progressed beyond the drawing board, though.

hey im a "whiny twelve year old" and i understand about it being an alpha,dont stereo type

say sorry

Relax, he obviously doesnt mean every 12 year old is whiny. But you gotta admit, the younger audience are probably the ones who dont understand that this game is in Alpha.

Anyway, I find it funny that even though Jool is so far away, its going to be much easier to get to than Moho.

Those orbit and SOI pics are very interesting.

Moho -- 0.4 KU (5.4e9 m), 2.5e22 kg (0.46 Kerbins)

Eve -- 0.8 KU (1.1e10 m), 9.47e22 kg (1.8 Kerbins)

Duna -- 1.4 KU (1.9e10 m), 5.56e21 kg (0.1 Kerbins)

Jool -- 5 KU (6.8e10 m), 4.34e24 kg (80 Kerbins)

Better figures will wait for someone with a ruler. Or 0.17, when they'll get much easier to work out.

UmbralRaptor, is this correct, Duna is 0.1 Kerbins, but Moho is 0.46 Kerbins?
when 0.17 comes out, im gonna not kill any kerbals... Extensive tests will be taken out to make sure my rockets are safe

when 0.17 comes out, im gonna not kill any kerbals... Extensive tests will be taken out to make sure my rockets are safe

That what they all say. But as soon as one accident happens, you start laughing and enjoying it. And before you know it, youre killing kerbals on purpose for your own amusment!
How many will die in your tests?

Is there a relationship between SOI size and body mass? Or are those just rough guesses?

No, SOI size is related to the mass ratio between the body and its primary, and the square of the distance between the two. In a two-body patched conics universe, a body's SOI ends at the distance where the gravity force of its primary is stronger than that of the body itself.
well if there is an unmanned capsule, then none will but if no unmanned capsule, hundreds... maybe thousands

how many will die in your tests?

ovar...8999!

ovar...8999!

...You killed it ;(

This looks interesting. That's one heck of a transfer burn you're going to need...

If you slingshot around Duna it shouldn't be too bad, right?

Wow, gotta take quite some skill to get into orbit of the gas giant, lol.

And quite some time aswell.

Wow, gotta take quite some skill to get into orbit of the gas giant, lol.

And quite some time aswell.

Moho is the hardest to get an orbit in for sure. Jool looks quite easy with that HUGE sol
I think the problem won't be to reach the orbit of a planet. It will be extremely hard to catch the planets because of their very large orbits and their low velocity...

I'm not too worried about getting to Jool... Getting out will be very tough.
